conclusion: Use the ideal gas law and properties of the processes in the cycle to determine temperature at state C.
At state A, pressure is P1, volume is V1, temperature is T0.
Using ideal gas law at state A: P1 V1 = nRT0.
Process AB is isochoric; volume remains V1, pressure changes from P1 to P2.
Temperature at state B: P2 V1 = nRTB, TB = T0 (P2/P1).
Process BC is isobaric; pressure remains P2, volume changes from V1 to V2.
Temperature at state C: P2 V2 = nRTC, TC = T0 (P2/P1) (V2/V1).
Conclusion: Temperature at state C is TC = T0 (P2/P1) (V2/V1).
Final Answer: Temperature at state C is T0 (P2/P1) (V2/V1).
